H0.text: Which constellation has, uniquely, in Rigel and Betelgeuse, two of the ten brightest stars. Canis Major

H1.text: Which constellation has, uniquely, in Rigel and Betelgeuse, two of the ten brightest stars. Carina

H2.text: Which constellation has, uniquely, in Rigel and Betelgeuse, two of the ten brightest stars. Centaurus

H3.text: Which constellation has, uniquely, in Rigel and Betelgeuse, two of the ten brightest stars. ORION

A4.text: Rigel (β) and Betelgeuse (α), are both among the brightest stars in the night sky; both are supergiants and slightly variable.

A5.text: It is generally the 11th-brightest star in the night sky, but this has varied between being the tenth to the 23rd-brightest by the end of 2019.

A6.text: Rigel is the brightest star in the constellation Orion.

A7.text: It is occasionally outshone by Betelgeuse.
